result.execSummary:
The defendant Reginald L Bratchett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay DNA sample, pay surcharge.   
Pay all mandatory costs, assessments, surcharges, victim witnes surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by DOC. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Any bail to apply.
Obtain/maintain employment as able to do so.
Mental health evaluation.  Take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

No violent contact with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harrassment".
No contact with firearms.
No new law violations.

Attend and successfully complete anger management and continued programming.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate.
Restitution set at zero.
AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Reginald L Bratchett in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Probation Agent is in court by telephone.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Reginald L Bratchett in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 75 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 2 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 25 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 2-12-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete  Anger Management and continued programming.
-Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment".
-Obtain/maintain employment as able to do so.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-Restitution is set at 0.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.

Defendant Reginald L Bratchett in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter was set for jury today and has resolved.  As to count 2:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Count 1 is ordered dismissed and read in.
Case is adjourned to 11-6-2015 at 8:15 for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Reginald L Bratchett in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Additional discovery has been provided to defense.  Case remains in trial posture.

Defendant Reginald L Bratchett in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Reginald L Bratchett in court with attorney Christian Eichenlaub for Torrie R. Williams.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Received & Filed, Motion to Withdraw As Attorney & Order. Defense motion to withdraw as counsel, GRANTED. Court signed order filed by defnese. Case adjourend for a Bail/Bond Hearing and Status Conference in branch 38.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Court orders No Contact order to remain in effect.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Reginald L Bratchett in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 23, Judge Grady.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Reginald L Bratchett NOT in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  William T Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set over from 7/9/2015, 2nd call.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited, but held pending restitution and recompense. Court VACATED Final Pretrial & Jury Trial dates.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant did NOT appear in court. Case set for a Bail/Bond Hearing. At request of defense counsel, court passed the case.

Defendant Reginald L Bratchett NOT in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel waived Mr.  Bratchett's appearance. Case called at request of Defense counsel to address substitution against Judge Kremers. FILE NOT IN COURT. Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed. Court consented to substitution against Judge KREMERS.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38 Court Vacated the Final Pretrial & Jury Trial dates in branch 36 and set matter before branch 38. Matter remains set for a bail Hearing on 7/9/2015 at 1:30 PM.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Request for modification of the No Contact orders. State opposes.  Court orders the No Contact order to remain.

Defendant Reginald L Bratchett in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont for Torrie R. Williams.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned for a Bail Hearing in branch 23 and Final Pretrial and Jury Trial in branch 36.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with REBECCA W. OR HER CHILDREN. 
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Reginald L Bratchett in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Reginald L Bratchett in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
